sub_title: I don't humble brag. Multi-lingual manager, lawyer, military officer and photographer
summary: I am a creative polyglot manager, lawyer and military officer with lots of experience from multi-disciplinary organisations – the UN, the EU and the armed forces, including field experience – on law, policy and international relations. I recently finished writing the new manual on international humanitarian law of the Swedish Armed Forces. In parallel I am also active as a photographer.

Visual Storytelling: An introduction for directors, writers and producers
26th Advanced Course on the Law of Armed Conflict

authors.headline: I don't humble brag. Multi-lingual manager, lawyer, military officer and photographer
I don't humble brag. Multi-lingual manager, lawyer, military officer and photographer

profile_positions.description: I am a reserve officer in the Swedish Marine Corps of the Swedish Navy.  Since 2013 I am designated Legal Advisor at the Swedish Armed Forces HQ pursuant to Additional Protocol I to the Geneva Conventions. I advise military commanders on the operational level and their staffs on international humanitarian law and related domestic legislation, human rights law, mission mandates and rules of engagement in the context of any type of armed conflict. Prior to 2013 I served in the fields of tactics, command and communications on regimental, brigade and battalion levels. I have considerable experience and training in group leadership, management and operations.
profile_positions.title: Lieutenant Colonel (OF-4) & Legal Advisor

profile_positions.description: Managed a year-long 100,000 Euro project to reach out to some 5000 victims in the Central African Republic to ascertain their needs for assistance following the acquittal of Jean-Pierre Bemba. Also led project to redesign the Court's system for classifying sensitive information. Worked with various other projects concerning organisational improvements.
profile_positions.title: Victims Participation and Reparations Section

profile_positions.description:
ICTY was a criminal court established by the United Nations Security Council, which tried the most senior civilian and military leaders for crimes perpetrated during the Balkan wars in the 1990s. ICTY developed humanitarian law and international criminal law to an unprecedented degree, gave victims of atrocities a voice and incontrovertibly showed that positions of authority do not shield individuals from responsibility. 

I led multi-national legal teams during several long and complex trials, acting as a primary advisor to judges on legal and managerial matters and serving as quality control for the sum of the teams' legal advice. In addition to representing management on working groups, I also designed and implemented organisation-improving projects, for instance with respect to case management, handling of confidential evidence, international judicial co-operation and the archiving of the ICTY's records and documentation.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader

profile_positions.description: Member of the EU External Action Service's team which planned for the creation and operation of the Kosovo Specialist Chambers and Specialist Prosecutor's Office set up in The Hague to address allegations of war crimes, crimes against humanity and organised crime committed in Kosovo in 1999-2000. Participated in the drafting of new national legislation, the rules of procedure and evidence and several internal regulations concerning for instance rules on detention, victims participation and legal aid.
profile_positions.title: Legal Expert Kosovo Special Court Planning Team

company.name: European Union Naval Force (EUNAVFOR) Operation Atalanta / Swedish Navy

profile_positions.company: European Union Naval Force - Operation ATALANTA
profile_positions.description: The European Union Naval Force protects vulnerable shipping in the Gulf of Aden and the Indian Ocean, escorts World Food Programme vessels to and from Somalia, and disrupts piracy activities by hunting and capturing suspected pirates. Advised the commander of the Swedish naval force and his staff on all legal matters, developed standard operating procedures for use by the force and subsequent Swedish contingents and trained the 120-strong crew in human rights, the law of self defence and rules of engagement. Also liaised with several East African and Middle Eastern states and successfully arranged diplomatic agreements necessary for mission fulfilment.
profile_positions.title: Legal Advisor & Major (OF-3)

profile_positions.description: OHR oversees the implementation of the 1995 Dayton Peace Agreement which ended the conflict in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Advisor to the High Representative on policies to strengthen Bosnian human rights institutions and improve national authorities' respect for human rights. Focal point vis-a-vis United Nations and OSCE stakeholders and co-ordinated human rights-related efforts in-country with them.
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Institutions Coordinator

profile_positions.description: CRA regulates the electronic media (radio and television) and telecommunications industries in Bosnia. Advisor to the Chief Executive Officer during the tender for the third GSM licence which created a competitive Bosnian telecom market. Served as liaison with the Office of the High Representative on national media and telecom policy and represented the CRA on two legislative committees to modernise the national legislative framework in the field of media and telecommunications.
profile_positions.title: International Legal Advisor

profile_positions.description: OHR set up the IMC to bring order to the electronic frequency spectrum in post-war Bosnia by subjecting radio and television broadcasters to a licensing regime with clear content, quality and technical conditions. Advisor to the IMC Director during the licensing process which created a viable radio- and television market in Bosnia.
profile_positions.title: Legal Advisor (part-time)

company.name: Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina

profile_positions.company: Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina
profile_positions.description: In the Dayton Peace Agreement, the Constitutional Court – Bosnia’s supreme court – was given jurisdiction based on the European Convention on Human Rights. Advised the nine judges of the court on comparative constitutional law, human rights law and public international law, including on high-profile cases addressing equal treatment of citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina regardless of ethnicity.
profile_positions.title: Legal Advisor

volunteer_experiences.role: Trainer during workshop in Abuja, Nigeria
volunteer_experiences.description: Trained prosecutors and investigators of the Nigerian Complex Crimes Group on fundamental international humanitarian law, international humanitarian rights law and international criminal law with emphasis on positive complementarity actions in respect of the ongoing conflict with Boko Haram in northern Nigeria.

On a roster of experts for rapid deployment upon request of the international community to investigate situations involving reported serious violations of human rights. http://www.justicerapidresponse.org/
Lectured on recent developments in international criminal law and international humanitarian law to the Operational Law Course. http://www.natoschool.nato.int
A part of the work at the ICTY was to inform visitors about the tribunal and its important work. I have given numerous such presentations concerning ICTY’s operations, challenges and achievements.
I have taught during several courses on humanitarian law to officers, non-commissioned officers, soldiers and civilian managers in the armed forces of Sweden and other Baltic states.

company.name: International Junior Officer Leadership Development course (IJOLD)

volunteer_experiences.description: IJOLD is an advanced one-week program organised by the United States Air Force and its European counterparts to improve leadership skills through immersive seminars and exercises. I coached a group of eight officers during exercises and ensured that learning objectives were met.
